		Question: what did thomas malthus do
		Answer:
answer: Thomas Malthus was a political economist who wrote about the Poor Laws and the principles of political economy. He was a member of the FRS and died on 29 December 1834. He was an Anglican and a free-trader. His work was part of the Malthusian controversy, which was a debate about the relationship between population and resources.
